personal_info.name: Joanna Giota
personal_info.headline: Professor in education at University of Gothenburg
personal_info.company: Harvard University Graduate School of Education
personal_info.summary:
1989–1994: Research assistant; 1996-1997: Visiting doctoral student (6 months.), Amsterdam University, Department of developmental and social psychology; 1994-2001: Doctoral grant (“doktorandtjänst”); 2002-2004: Leader of the project: The importance of motivation for learning, school achievement and educational choice (Financial supported by the Swedish Research Council; VR); 2004–2006: Leader of the project: Evaluation Through Follow-up: Cohort-sequential longitudinal databases (ETF) (VR): 2005-2007: Co-worker as researcher within the project: Grades and grades assignment: Functions and effects (GRAM) (VR); 2007-2009: Leader of the project: Evaluation Through Follow-up: Cohort-sequential longitudinal databases (ETF) (VR); 2008-2012: Leader of the project: Special education in comprehensive school: extent, forms and effects (STOFF) (VR); 2010-2012, Writer of a research review: Individualization in school, commissioned by VR; 2011- Leader of the project: Self-regulation, Information technology and knowledge (sIKT) (Financial supported by Frida Utbildning AB); Co-worker as researcher within the project: Evaluation Through Follow-up: Cohort-sequential longitudinal databases (ETF) (VR); 2013- Co-worker as researcher within the project: School achievement and the educational situation of children and adolescents placed in foster-homes or institutions (FAS); 2013- Co-worker as researcher within the project: The impacts of changed living conditions on child and adolescent mental health (FAS); 2015- Leader of the project: Consequences of individualized teaching for students’ motivation to learn and achievements over 50 years – educational reforms and societal Changes (VR).     Specialties: Research and evaluation studies in the field of education and psychology at national and international level. Advanced statistical analyses.
